article.headline: Illinois St. 51, N. Iowa 46
article.story: NORMAL, Ill. (AP) -- Osiris Eldridge scored 13 points to lead Illinois State to a 51-46 win over Northern Iowa on Tuesday night. Illinois State (12-3, 4-0 Missouri Valley) held on to win despite just one field goal in the final 13 minutes. Both teams struggled shooting, with the score tied 9-9 after eight minutes. The Redbirds then went on a 27-10 run and led 36-19 at the break. The second half also started at a slow pace, with Illinois State going 4-for-12 and Northern Iowa (10-5, 2-2) 2-for-10 from the field. The Panthers climbed back into the contest with a 22-3 run to pull to 47-46. But free-throws by Levi Dyer, Dinma Odiakosa and Eldridge iced the game. Adam Koch led Northern Iowa with 13 points and 10 rebounds. Jared Josten added 10 points for the Panthers.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
